item.title: 股价创下历史新高后，日本顶级经纪公司首席执行官看到了更多收益
item.description: 随着日本股市在今年首个交易日创下历史新高，日本最大经纪公司的首席执行官们预测，最好的情况还在后头。【原文：As Japan’s stocks hit a record high on the first day of trading this year, the chief executive officers of its biggest brokerages are predicting that the best is yet to come.】

item.title: 土耳其通胀进一步放缓，支持 2026 年降息
item.description: 土耳其通胀率连续第三个月放缓，这有可能使央行在新的一年里维持利率下行的趋势。【原文：Turkish inflation slowed for the third month in a row, potentially allowing the central bank to maintain its downward interest-rate path in the new year.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数突破 10,000 点后将继续上涨
泰国将审查被认为与家庭成本不符的消费物价指数
item.description: 泰国中央银行认为，持续走低的通胀数据并没有反映出生活成本的上升，因此计划对其通胀篮子进行审查。【原文：Thailand plans to review its inflation basket as the country’s central bank observed persistently low figures don’t reflect elevated costs of living.】

item.title: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔提出任期限制以重振支持率
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）承诺引入任期限制立法，兑现了他在竞选时许下的长期承诺，他希望重新获得主要选民群体的支持。【原文：Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim pledged to introduce term-limit legislation, delivering on a long-promised campaign pledge as he looks to regain support from his key voter base.】

item.title: 从银行到可再生能源：被看好在 2026 年上市的欧洲股票
item.description: 在经历了自 2021 年以来欧洲股市表现最好的一年后，分析师和策略师预测该地区的股市在 2026 年仍有更大的发展空间。【原文：After the best year for European equities since 2021, analysts and strategists predict the region’s stocks have still more to give in 2026.】

item.title: 美国干预后外国在委内瑞拉的石油开采权成疑
item.description: 在华盛顿于上周末逮捕了尼古拉斯-马杜罗总统之后，外国公司根据现有协议有权获得的数十亿桶委内瑞拉石油的未来成了疑问。【原文：The future of billions of barrels of Venezuelan oil that foreign companies are entitled to under current agreements has been thrown into doubt following Washington’s capture of President Nicolás Maduro over the weekend.】

item.title: 印度 ITC 因烟草税影响股价而失去三分之一的买入要求
item.description: ITC Ltd. 已失去了分析师们的青睐，三分之一的分析师下调了对这家国内顶级卷烟生产商的建议评级。【原文：ITC Ltd. has lost its status as a favorite among analysts, with a third of them downgrading recommendations on the nation’s top cigarette maker.】

item.title: 印度顶级资产管理公司选择花旗和汇丰进行 14 亿美元的首次公开募股
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，SBI 基金管理有限公司已聘请九家银行为其拟议的首次公开募股提供建议，该募股可能在 2026 年上半年筹集约 14 亿美元。【原文：SBI Funds Management Ltd. has hired nine banks to advise on a proposed initial public offering that may raise around $1.4 billion in the first half of 2026, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 马杜罗下台加剧地缘政治风险，美元走强
item.description: 在美国推翻委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗的举动引发地缘政治风险上升后，彭博社的美元指数升至两周来的最强水平。【原文：A Bloomberg gauge of the dollar rose to the strongest level in two weeks after the US move to oust Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro sparked an increase in geopolitical risks.】

item.title: 欧元区日益壮大的东翼希望坐上欧洲央行的头把交椅
item.description: 东欧正在为在欧洲中央银行高层中占有一席之地发起最强有力的推动。【原文：Eastern Europe is mounting its strongest push yet to secure a seat among the European Central Bank’s top brass.】

item.title: 菲律宾削减 2026 年国内生产总值增长目标，因为贪污腐败之痛仍在持续
item.description: 菲律宾政府下调了今年的经济增长目标，因为它预计大范围腐败丑闻的影响将持续到 2026 年上半年。【原文：The Philippine government cut its economic growth target for this year, as it expects the fallout from the wide-scale corruption scandal to persist in the first half of 2026.】

item.title: 印度债券下跌，国债销售增加加剧供应困境
item.description: 在各邦公布了一项规模超过预期的借贷计划后，印度政府债券下跌，加剧了对供应的担忧。【原文：Indian government bonds fell after states unveiled a larger-than-expected borrowing plan, heightening supply concerns.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Tribeca 看好委内瑞拉 127% 的涨幅后的 "淘金热
item.description: 投资组合经理本-克利里（Ben Cleary）的对冲基金去年的资金增加了一倍多，对于他来说，在唐纳德-特朗普发动有争议的攻击之后，委内瑞拉是投资者有史以来最大的赚钱机会之一。【原文：For portfolio manager Ben Cleary, whose hedge fund more than doubled its money last year, Venezuela in the aftermath of Donald Trump’s controversial attack is one of the biggest ever opportunities for investors to make money.】

item.title: 为什么市场可以静观委内瑞拉的戏剧性变化？
item.description:
遗憾的是，这个国家已经成为一个 "篮子"，受到冲击时几乎不会产生更广泛的影响。【原文：

Sadly, the country has become such a basket case that a shock has little wider impact.

】

item.title: 委内瑞拉石油流失对中国的打击因海上囤积石油而减弱
item.description: 美国对委内瑞拉的震撼性干预很可能会阻碍石油流向中国，尽管大量被制裁的原油储存在海上，短期影响会有所缓和。【原文：The US’s shock intervention in Venezuela will likely choke oil flows to China, although the short-term impact will be softened by large volumes of sanctioned crude being stored at sea.】

item.title: 美国突袭后丰田公司通知委内瑞拉员工在家工作
item.description: 丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor Corp.）已通知其在委内瑞拉的员工在家工作，因为该公司正在关注特朗普政府周末令人震惊地推翻总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗（Nicolás Maduro）所带来的影响。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp. has told its employees in Venezuela to work from home as the company monitors the fallout from the Trump administration’s stunning ouster of President Nicolás Maduro over the weekend.】

item.title: 地区和国内政治动荡不安，以色列将维持利率不变
item.description: 以色列央行将在 2026 年的首次货币决策中保持利率稳定，同时权衡降低的通胀预期和坚挺的谢克尔，以及挥之不去的地缘政治和财政不确定性。【原文：Israel’s central bank is set to hold interest rates steady in its first monetary decision of 2026, weighing lowered inflation expectations and a strong shekel against lingering geopolitical and fiscal uncertainty.】

item.title: 高盛将目标股价上调 35%，台积电股价创四月以来最大涨幅
item.description: 台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. shares climbed by the most since April, as the world’s largest contract chipmaker rides a continued wave of optimism over artificial intelligence demand into the new year.】

item.title: 据说 MiniMax 计划借助人工智能热潮在香港上市
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，MiniMax 计划将其香港首次公开募股的价格定在市场定价范围的顶端，这反映了投资者对中国初创企业的热情，这些企业正日益向 OpenAI 等美国竞争对手发起挑战。【原文：MiniMax plans to price its Hong Kong initial public offering at the top of the marketed range, people familiar with the matter said, reflecting investor enthusiasm for Chinese startups that are increasingly challenging US rivals like OpenAI.】

item.title: 菲律宾总统马科斯丑闻后在 2026 年预算中为贪污开 "后门
item.description: 菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯（Ferdinand Marcos Jr.）周一签署了价值 6.793 万亿比索（约合 1,150 亿美元）的 2026 年预算，使之成为法律，他的政府旨在重振因政府腐败丑闻而受阻的经济。【原文：Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Monday signed into law the 2026 budget worth 6.793 trillion pesos ($115 billion) as his administration aims to revive an economy stunted by a government corruption scandal.】

item.title: 上田向银行家强调日本央行继续提高利率的意图
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫在新年首次公开露面，在对私人银行家的演讲中强调了继续提高基准利率的意图。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda used his first public appearance in the new year to underscore his intention to keep raising the benchmark rate in a speech to private bankers.】

item.title: 三星发布新款超大、色彩丰富的电视，配备更多人工智能功能
item.description: 三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co.）发布了其 2026 年家庭影院产品阵容，旨在巩固其作为领先电视机制造商的地位，应对日益激烈的竞争以及其所描述的向巨型电视机的转变。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. unveiled its 2026 home theater lineup, aiming to cement its position as the leading TV maker amid intensifying competition and what it described as a shift toward jumbo televisions.】

item.title: 财政和通胀担忧挥之不去，日本长期债券下跌
item.description: 由于财政和通胀忧虑继续拖累市场，日本的长期国债在 2026 年开局不利。【原文：Japan’s long-maturity government bonds kicked off 2026 on a downbeat note, as fiscal and inflation worries continued to weigh on the market.】

item.title: 关税忧虑和风险偏好情绪令铜价飙升至创纪录水平
item.description: 由于担心新的一年供应会收紧，以及更广泛市场的风险情绪，铜价飙升至创纪录水平。【原文：Copper surged toward a record on concerns about tightening supplies in the new year, as well as a risk-on mood in wider markets.】

item.title: 中国服务业增速再度放缓，创六个月新低
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，中国服务业活动的扩张速度为六个月来最弱，原因是游客人数减少导致新出口业务重现萎缩。【原文：China’s services activity expanded at the weakest pace in six months, according to a private survey, as new export business returned to contraction because of fewer tourist arrivals.】

item.title: 新兴市场股市因科技股乐观而创下历史新高
item.description: 在亚洲科技股持续走强和全球股市普遍反弹的推动下，新兴市场股市有望创下历史新高。【原文：Emerging-market stocks are on track to hit a record, buoyed by persistent strength in Asian technology shares and a broad rally globally.】

item.title: 亚洲借款人年初开始加紧出售债券
item.description: 周一，亚洲的借款人启动了 2026 年的美元债券销售，分析师预计，今年全球企业将测试发行记录，为从人工智能基础设施到美国投资等各种活动提供资金。【原文：Borrowers from Asia on Monday kicked off dollar bond sales for 2026, in a year when analysts expect corporates globally to test issuance records to fund everything from AI infrastructure to investments in the US.】

item.title: 预计下周天气转暖，美国天然气下跌
item.description: 美国天然气期货跌至 10 月下旬以来的最低点，因为据预测，下周气温将升高，这可能会减少对燃料的需求。【原文：US natural gas futures dropped to the lowest since late October amid forecasts for warmer temperatures next week, which is likely to reduce demand for the fuel.】

item.title: 智能秤先驱推出 600 美元型号，可跟踪高血压风险
item.description: 率先推出 Wi-Fi 浴室秤的法国公司 Withings 推出了一款可监测高血压症状的新型顶级型号，这是试图帮助控制高血压的消费保健小工具浪潮中的最新产品。【原文：Withings, the French company that pioneered the category of Wi-Fi bathroom scales, unveiled a new top-of-the-line model that monitors signs of hypertension, the latest in a wave of consumer health gadgets attempting to help manage high blood pressure.】
